001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.util.function.Function;
004
005import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
006
007import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheConfig;
008import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheFormatter;
009import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheFormatterTypes;
010
011/**
012 * Formats and then sends the results to the downstream appender.
013 *
014 * Implementations should be singleton like and should not contain state. By default
015 * native types are passed straight through to the downstream appender. If this is not
016 * desired one can override those methods.
017 * <p>
018 * <em>Important: the formatter does not decide what types are allowed at compile time to
019 * be formatted.</em> To control what types are allowed to be formatted see
020 * {@link JStacheFormatterTypes}.
021 *
022 * <h2>Implementing</h2>
023 *
024 * An alternative to implementing this complicated interface is to simply make a
025 * {@code Function<@Nullable Object, String>} and call {@link #of(Function)} to create a
026 * formatter.
027 * <p>
028 * To implement a custom formatter:
029 *
030 * <ol>
031 * <li>Implement this interface or use {@link #of(Function)}.</li>
032 * <li>Register the custom formatter with {@link JStacheFormatter}.</li>
033 * <li>Add additional allowed types with {@link JStacheFormatterTypes} on to the class
034 * that is annotated with {@link JStacheFormatter}</li>
035 * <li>Set {@link JStacheConfig#formatter()} to the class that has the
036 * {@link JStacheFormatter}.</li>
037 * </ol>
038 * <em>It is the formatters responsibility to handle <code>null</code> for
039 * {@linkplain Formatter#format(Appender, Output, String, Class, Object) nullable format
040 * calls} as the downstream appender do not allow <code>null</code>. </em>
041 *
042 * @apiNote Although the formatter has access to the raw {@link Output} the formatter
043 * should never use it directly and simply pass it on to the downstream appender.
044 * @author agentgt
045 * @see JStacheFormatterTypes
046 * @see JStacheFormatter
047 *
048 */
049public interface Formatter extends Function<@Nullable Object, String> {
050
051        /**
052         * Formats an object by using {@link StringBuilder} and calling
053         * {@link #format(Appender, Output, String, Class, Object)}.
054         * @param t the object to be formatted. Maybe <code>null</code>.
055         * @return the formatted results as a String.
056         */
057        @Override
058        default String apply(@Nullable Object t) {
059                var sb = new Output.StringOutput(new StringBuilder());
060                format(Appender.defaultAppender(), sb, "", Object.class, t);
061                return sb.toString();
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Formats the object and then sends the results to the downstream appender.
066         *
067         *
068         * @apiNote Although the formatter has access to the raw {@link Appendable} the
069         * formatter should never use it directly and simply pass it on to the downstream
070         * appender.
071         * @param <A> the appendable type
072         * @param <E> the appender exception type
073         * @param downstream the downstream appender to be used instead of the appendable
074         * directly
075         * @param a the appendable to be passed to the appender
076         * @param path the dotted mustache like path
077         * @param c the object class but is not guaranteed to be accurate. If it is not known
078         * Object.class will be used.
079         * @param o the object which maybe null
080         * @throws E if the appender or appendable throws an exception
081         */
082
083        <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void format(Appender downstream, A a, String path, Class<?> c,
084                        @Nullable Object o) throws E;
085
086        /**
087         * Formats the object and then sends the results to the downstream appender. The
088         * default implementation passes natives through to the downstream appender.
089         *
090         * @apiNote Although the formatter has access to the raw {@link Appendable} the
091         * formatter should never use it directly and simply pass it on to the downstream
092         * appender.
093         * @param <A> the appendable type
094         * @param <E> the appender exception type
095         * @param downstream the downstream appender to be used instead of the appendable
096         * directly
097         * @param a the appendable to be passed to the appender
098         * @param path the dotted mustache like path
099         * @param c character
100         * @throws E if the appender or appendable throws an exception
101         */
102        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void format(Appender downstream, A a, String path, char c)
103                        throws E {
104                downstream.append(a, c);
105        }
106
107        /**
108         * Formats the object and then sends the results to the downstream appender. The
109         * default implementation passes natives through to the downstream appender.
110         *
111         * @apiNote Although the formatter has access to the raw {@link Appendable} the
112         * formatter should never use it directly and simply pass it on to the downstream
113         * appender.
114         * @param <A> the appendable type
115         * @param <E> the appender exception type
116         * @param downstream the downstream appender to be used instead of the appendable
117         * directly
118         * @param a the appendable to be passed to the appender
119         * @param path the dotted mustache like path
120         * @param s short
121         * @throws E if the appender or appendable throws an exception
122         */
123        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void format(Appender downstream, A a, String path, short s)
124                        throws E {
125                downstream.append(a, s);
126        }
127
128        /**
129         * Formats the object and then sends the results to the downstream appender. The
130         * default implementation passes natives through to the downstream appender.
131         *
132         * @apiNote Although the formatter has access to the raw {@link Appendable} the
133         * formatter should never use it directly and simply pass it on to the downstream
134         * appender.
135         * @param <A> the appendable type
136         * @param <E> the appender exception type
137         * @param downstream the downstream appender to be used instead of the appendable
138         * directly
139         * @param a the appendable to be passed to the appender
140         * @param path the dotted mustache like path
141         * @param i integer
142         * @throws E if the appender or appendable throws an exception
143         */
144        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void format(Appender downstream, A a, String path, int i)
145                        throws E {
146                downstream.append(a, i);
147        }
148
149        /**
150         * Formats the object and then sends the results to the downstream appender. The
151         * default implementation passes natives through to the downstream appender.
152         *
153         * @apiNote Although the formatter has access to the raw {@link Appendable} the
154         * formatter should never use it directly and simply pass it on to the downstream
155         * appender.
156         * @param <A> the appendable type
157         * @param <E> the appender exception type
158         * @param downstream the downstream appender to be used instead of the appendable
159         * directly
160         * @param a the appendable to be passed to the appender
161         * @param path the dotted mustache like path
162         * @param l long
163         * @throws E if the appender or appendable throws an exception
164         */
165        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void format(Appender downstream, A a, String path, long l)
166                        throws E {
167                downstream.append(a, l);
168        }
169
170        /**
171         * Formats the object and then sends the results to the downstream appender. The
172         * default implementation passes natives through to the downstream appender.
173         *
174         * @apiNote Although the formatter has access to the raw {@link Appendable} the
175         * formatter should never use it directly and simply pass it on to the downstream
176         * appender.
177         * @param <A> the appendable type
178         * @param <E> the appender exception type
179         * @param downstream the downstream appender to be used instead of the appendable
180         * directly
181         * @param a the appendable to be passed to the appender
182         * @param path the dotted mustache like path
183         * @param d double
184         * @throws E if the appender or appendable throws an exception
185         */
186        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void format(Appender downstream, A a, String path, double d)
187                        throws E {
188                downstream.append(a, d);
189        }
190
191        /**
192         * Formats the object and then sends the results to the downstream appender. The
193         * default implementation passes natives through to the downstream appender.
194         *
195         * @apiNote Although the formatter has access to the raw {@link Appendable} the
196         * formatter should never use it directly and simply pass it on to the downstream
197         * appender.
198         * @param <A> the appendable type
199         * @param <E> the appender exception type
200         * @param downstream the downstream appender to be used instead of the appendable
201         * directly
202         * @param a the appendable to be passed to the appender
203         * @param path the dotted mustache like path
204         * @param b boolean
205         * @throws E if the appender or appendable throws an exception
206         */
207        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void format(Appender downstream, A a, String path, boolean b)
208                        throws E {
209                downstream.append(a, b);
210        }
211
212        /**
213         * Formats the object and then sends the results to the downstream appender. The
214         * default implementation calls
215         * {@link #format(Appender, Output, String, Class, Object)} and it is generally
216         * recommend you override for performance.
217         *
218         * @apiNote Although the formatter has access to the raw {@link Appendable} the
219         * formatter should never use it directly and simply pass it on to the downstream
220         * appender. Also take note that the string value maybe null!
221         * @param <A> the appendable type
222         * @param <E> the appender exception type
223         * @param downstream the downstream appender to be used instead of the appendable
224         * directly
225         * @param a the appendable to be passed to the appender
226         * @param path the dotted mustache like path
227         * @param s String value which maybe <code>null</code>.
228         * @throws E if the appender or appendable throws an exception
229         */
230        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void format(Appender downstream, A a, String path,
231                        @Nullable String s) throws E {
232                format(downstream, a, path, String.class, s);
233        }
234
235        /**
236         * Adapts a function to a formatter.
237         *
238         * If the function is already a formatter then it is simply returned (noop). Thus it
239         * is safe to repeatedly call this on formatters. If the function is adapted the
240         * returned adapted formatter does not pass native types to the inputted function.
241         * @param formatterFunction if it is already an escaper
242         * @return adapted formattter
243         */
244        public static Formatter of(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Function<@Nullable Object, String> formatterFunction) {
245                if (formatterFunction instanceof Formatter f) {
246                        return f;
247                }
248                return new ObjectFunctionFormatter(formatterFunction);
249        }
250
251}
252
253class ObjectFunctionFormatter implements Formatter {
254
255        private final Function<@Nullable Object, String> function;
256
257        public ObjectFunctionFormatter(Function<@Nullable Object, String> function) {
258                super();
259                this.function = function;
260        }
261
262        @Override
263        public <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void format(Appender downstream, A a, String path, Class<?> c,
264                        @Nullable Object o) throws E {
265                String result = function.apply(o);
266                downstream.append(a, result);
267        }
268
269}
